Author: Mr. Distinguished#9941
Content: Would it be considered normal for a website to have multiple style sheets, ie: one for each page? Or is this sort of thing considerd bad design?

Author: curiouskiwi#1671
Content: the advantage to style sheets is that you can change a style globally (across all your pages) by only changing it once.  You would lose that if you had separate sheets for each page.

Author: Lord of Galaxy#9211
Content: You can have one global style sheet that decides the general design of the website, and some smaller separate style sheets for whatever is used by only a single page

Author: Lord of Galaxy#9211
Content: Global style sheets can save bandwidth too if used properly, as they're static files

Author: Blauelf#6622
Content: Attacking Homepage now. Feeling set back to the 90s, when I learnt HTML (no CSS around that time, but I *did* use `<blink>` and `<marquee>` as David said! Also, bright colours. And different JavaScript for Internet Explorer and Netscape Navigator)

Author: Blauelf#6622
Content: Layout by tables. Still a thing in emails.

Author: Blauelf#6622
Content: Just now with things like `margin` in CSS properties, not specific attributes.

Author: Blauelf#6622
Content: I used the GridBagLayout in Java Swing, which is very similar.

Author: Blauelf#6622
Content: Too bad Swing was not possible in applets, as those would not be compatible with the Microsoft Java VM (supporting 1.1.8 mostly, while Swing was a 1.2 addition - marketed as Java2 SDK 1.2)

Author: Blauelf#6622
Content: Yeah, the `homepage` problem seems a bit... old-fashioned and simple. But I have no idea how I would see it if I hadn't done HTML before.

Author: Blauelf#6622
Content: Maybe they want to avoid people doing table-based layouts üòõ

Author: Blauelf#6622
Content: And using bootstrap, and using it properly, you don't have to do all those `@media` queries for a design that looks great on all device sizes.

Author: Blauelf#6622
Content: Wondering how this is graded. Not having `check50` suggests manual grading, but that wouldn't scale well.

Author: Blauelf#6622
Content: That's what I think. Just not sure why we can't have a `check50` then. But maybe automatic checks are already more load than average pset.

Author: Blauelf#6622
Content:
Not sure whether to go Lorem ipsum, I would like to avoid it. Doing a page without a topic is... somewhat challenging in its own.

Also, I feel like copying bootstrap sample code without understanding half of their classes.

Author: Blauelf#6622
Content: Just submitted. The `check50` output is minimal, but I got 5/5 on correctness. I didn't even count the different HTML tags, should have been around 10. CSS-based layout means you no longer have tons of tables that boost the number of different elements by 3 (table, table row, table data)

Author: Blauelf#6622
Content: Uh-oh. Now only final project left, I did not procrastinate hard enough üòï

Author: HopefulPanic#5870
Content: @curiouskiwi  is there a way to disable bootstrap on a particular element. It seems to be overwriting my CSS formatting for <textarea>. If I remove the <link href=>, the <textarea> works and looks the way I want it to, but then I won't be able to use bootstrap on that page....

Author: curiouskiwi#1671
Content: because stylesheets "cascade"  (hence the name CSS "cascading style sheets") you should be able to override anything by simply redefining a style *after* the bootstrap stylesheet is pulled in.

Author: Blauelf#6622
Content: If I make the window pretty narrow by simulating a Galaxy S5 (Chrome has a pretty decent mobile device emulation, better than the one in Firefox), the text becomes really tiny. That's where one might want to switch from a 4x1 to a 2x2 or maybe even 1x4 layout for the four images.

Author: Blauelf#6622
Content: The Galaxy S5 has 360x640 pixel of logical resolution (with a ratio of 3 real pixels to 1 reported pixel, so the screen in reality is FullHD 1920x1080)

Author: Blauelf#6622
Content: Interesting. The page requests https://cdn.gamerant.com/wp-content/uploads/catherine-full-body-persona-5-dlc.jpg.optimal.jpg but that generates an HTTP status 520. Haven't seen that before.

Author: Exkywor#8158
Content: what do you mean by the image request?

Author: Blauelf#6622
Content: \@media queries in your CSS might help. Haven't used grid so far (well, when I learnt HTML, we used a grid, by abusing tables for layout, but that was before CSS)

Author: Exkywor#8158
Content: Ohh, thanks üòÑ Gonna look into queries

Author: Exkywor#8158
Content: at least I think I'm kinda close to getting it done xD

Author: Blauelf#6622
Content: I meant that my browser could not load that image. The CDN would respond with status 520, which seems to be cloudflare's message for "something went wrong".

Author: Exkywor#8158
Content: Ohhh, really?

Author: Exkywor#8158
Content: It loads well on the devices I've tested it

Author: Blauelf#6622
Content: The CDN is distributed, everybody being served by a server close to them. Maybe I got a server that had some kind of hiccup, while yours was fine.

Author: Exkywor#8158
Content: Ohhh

Author: Exkywor#8158
Content: I had no idea xD

Author: Blauelf#6622
Content: That's one of the points for using a CDN. It delivers static content from their cache close to the customer. Another is that they might be able to protect you from DDOS attacks by acting as a proxy and hiding your server's IP address (you have to stop them before the packets can saturate your server's internet connection, so usually on the ISP or CDN level).

Author: Exkywor#8158
Content: Ohhh

Author: Exkywor#8158
Content: That sounds nice

Author: Exkywor#8158
Content: üòÑ

Author: Blauelf#6622
Content: @Exkywor The major downside is that for most features to work, the cdn must access your traffic without encryption, so they in theory could read or manipulate content. Usually ok for static images, rest depends.

Author: Nornor#4436

Author: Blauelf#6622
Content:
Bootstrap provides a few classes that make building a small responsive layout really easy. I had a part that would be two-column on larger screens, and one column on narrower.
Most times "responsive" refers to using `@media`-queries in CSS to provide different layout.

Author: Blauelf#6622
Content: And bootstrap does exactly that with its `col-md-6` and similar classes.

Author: Nornor#4436

what is this error `Error: The element button must not appear as a descendant of the a element.` code snippet ```html
```

Author: tipsyninja#2615
Content: i tried inserting `a` tag inside `button` tag then the error says `must not appear as a descendant of the button element`

Author: kadavraverkisto#7943
Content: Well, <a> is a tag whose function is a reaction to click and <button> is a tag whose function is a reaction to click. Maybe it's logical that one is not to be placed inside of the other, because its behaviour would be sort of unpredictable then.

Content: you are right thanks

Author: Blauelf#6622
Content: I don't think `getCurrentPosition` returns anything. It's all async and callbacks.

Author: Blauelf#6622
Content: So your `alert` would have to be triggered by the callback, not run immediately.

Author: stuart_clark#0463
Content: `Have at least one stylesheet file of your own creation, styles.css, which uses at least five (5) different CSS selectors (e.g. tag (example), class (.example), or ID (#example)), and within which you use a total of at least five (5) different CSS properties, such as font-size, or margin;`  In pset5, do we have to use atleast five different properties in every CSS selector or total of 5 different CSS properties spanned over each CSS selector?

Author: meray#3929
Content: nah 5 different properties spanned across each css selector (so you have at least 5 different properties in your file in general)

Author: stuart_clark#0463
Content: @meray How complex is the scope of this pset5

Author: stuart_clark#0463
Content: @meray  because I am finding it hard to find the balance

Author: meray#3929

Author: stuart_clark#0463
Content: @meray  Yeah it is easy compared to C but I am actually finding it hard what is allowed or what is not.

Author: stuart_clark#0463
Content: @meray  and what is too complex and what  is just ok.

Author: kappilino#9875
Content: It‚Äòs a very big problem set to develope a real homepage /website. For a well looking and functional website you need month of planning and designing on paper even before you think to write one line of code. And one needs also knowledge how to design an ui, I think more than programming knowhow. It‚Äòs not an obvious exercise for an CS Class. Consequently I wrote a dummy site wich meets the given requirements but not more.

Author: Magdiel#9311
Content: Honestly, I agree.

Author: Magdiel#9311
Content: Back in my old CS course several years ago, we had to design a webpage as a final project. We were a team of 4 and it still took us a month to get it done, plus we were given a theme to follow beforehand.

Author: Magdiel#9311
Content: This being the problem set for a single week feels daunting. I haven't even touched the IDE yet, I'm still poring over docs for CSS and Bootstrap.

Author: curiouskiwi#1671

Author: kappilino#9875
Content:
I did not use bootstrap. Because it costs more time to learn a whole framework than to learn to create a little flexbox/grid layout. So I put the reference link for bootstrap in the header and not more. 
I think also that bootstrap makes the code bad to read. One reason is that the documentation does not use many html 5 tags and  prefererd to use divs for everything. With modern html and css capabilities this framework is not needed.

Author: chriso#1172
Blauelf#6622
Content:
That's an ugly part of JavaScript: If you don't specify anything, your variable is created implicitly global. Often this happens by accident.
`var` is function scope, similar to Python
`let` is block scope, like in C
So is the declaration and the loop happening in the same function?

Author: chriso#1172
Content: @Blauelf  yea so I declared the variable at the start of the function, the strange thing is I ran into the same problem again. The variable was declared using let and it worked in the following nested if statement. I then tried to use the variable again later down the line and it said it was undefined. I had to redefine it as a global for it to work.

Author: chriso#1172
Content: I tried redefining it with var but it still wouldnt work. All the if statements are in the one function.
